meanings.definition: To organize into a labor union.
meanings.sent1: The workers unionized to negotiate better pay and working conditions.
meanings.sent2: She unionized with her colleagues to have a stronger voice in the workplace.
meanings.sent3: The employees unionized and suddenly the boss had to listen to their demands.
meanings.sent4: The idea to unionize the workers spread like wildfire, igniting a sense of unity.
meanings.sent5: After they unionized, the employees felt empowered and united in their cause.

meanings.definition: To join or become a member of a labor union.
meanings.sent1: He unionized to stand in solidarity with his fellow workers.
meanings.sent2: They unionized to ensure fair treatment and representation at work.
meanings.sent3: When she unionized, she found a supportive community within the union.
meanings.sent4: The decision to unionize was a bridge to a stronger collective voice.
meanings.sent5: Joining the unionized workforce brought a sense of belonging and protection.
